title: Encapsulation Basics
description: Create a class with public, private, and protected attributes
starterCode:
# Create Employee class with proper encapsulation

class Employee:
    def __init__(self, name, salary, ssn):
        # Make name public, salary protected, ssn private
        pass

emp = Employee("Alice", 50000, "123-45-6789")
print(emp.name)  # Should work
print(emp._salary)  # Should work (protected)
# print(emp.__ssn)  # Should not work (private)
solution:
class Employee:
    def __init__(self, name, salary, ssn):
        self.name = name  # Public
        self._salary = salary  # Protected
        self.__ssn = ssn  # Private

emp = Employee("Alice", 50000, "123-45-6789")
print(emp.name)
print(emp._salary)
